question.text: We're going to arrive at Stonehenge in a few minutes, so let me tell you a little bit about it before we get there. As [you may know|z] , the huge stone circle of Stonehenge dates from about 1600 BC.
The stones are arranged in a circle and a U-shape. You [might be wondering|z] what the stones were used for.

params.instruct_panel_str: If you are unsure about how the animation above works click the "Instructions" button for help

mcq_xml.attemptsFailFeedback_str: The interaction will now be completed for you.

question.text: Well, it [might have been|couldn't have been|might not have been] a temple for worshipping the sun, because at particular times of the year the sun shines straight into the U-shape of the stones. Whatever its purpose, the people who built it worked very hard. The stones are extremely large and heavy and it's not certain how they got to Stonehenge.
question.modelAnswerString: Well, it might have been a temple for worshipping the sun, because at particular times of the year the sun shines straight into the U-shape of the stones. Whatever its purpose, the people who built it worked very hard. The stones are extremely large and heavy and it's not certain how they got to Stonehenge.

question.text: Some scholars say that hundreds of people [might have carried|couldn't have carried|might be carrying] them there.
question.modelAnswerString: Some scholars say that hundreds of people might have carried them there.

question.text: On the other hand, others now believe that glaciers [may have left|couldn't have left|may leave] the larger stones there.
question.modelAnswerString: On the other hand, others now believe that glaciers may have left the larger stones there.

question.text: What is certain is that the people who built Stonehenge [couldn't have created|may have created|may not have created] it without a lot of hard work and careful calculation.
question.modelAnswerString: What is certain is that the people who built Stonehenge couldn't have created it without a lot of hard work and careful calculation.

question.text: You [might be looking|might look|might not be looking] forward to enjoying a special atmosphere at Stonehenge. Well, I must warn you that there are two busy roads very close to it.
question.modelAnswerString: You might be looking forward to enjoying a special atmosphere at Stonehenge. Well, I must warn you that there are two busy roads very close to it.

question.text: You [may have heard|couldn't have heard|may be hearing] that there are plans for a new tunnel instead of the roads, but these have been cancelled.
question.modelAnswerString: You may have heard that there are plans for a new tunnel instead of the roads, but these have been cancelled.

question.text: However, at this time of day, there [may not be|might be|might not have been] too many visitors.
question.modelAnswerString: However, at this time of day, there may not be too many visitors.

question.text: Well, we're nearly at Stonehenge now, so I will stop talking. I realise that in this short description, I [may not have mentioned|may not be mentioning|may not mention] everything you want to know.
question.modelAnswerString: Well, we're nearly at Stonehenge now, so I will stop talking. I realise that in this short description, I may not have mentioned everything you want to know.

question.text: For that reason, you [might want|couldn't have wanted|might have wanted] to buy a guidebook at the gift shop.
question.modelAnswerString: For that reason, you might want to buy a guidebook at the gift shop.

question.text: The shop [may not have|may not have had|couldn't have had] a guidebook in your language, but it has audio guides in lots of languages. Here we are! I hope you enjoy your visit!
question.modelAnswerString: The shop may not have a guidebook in your language, but it has audio guides in lots of languages Here we are! I hope you enjoy your visit!
